au.com.innodev.wmboost.data

Interface CollectionEntry<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - collection element type to treat the entry value as
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseUnitEntry, HasKey

    public interface CollectionEntry<E>
extends BaseUnitEntry
    A reference to a unit entry where the value is a collection. Allows access and modification of the entry identified by the key.

    This type is suitable when the entry's value consists in a collection of elements, such as a list if strings. In contrast, a ItemEntry instance is used for an entry that contains a single element, such as a string.

    The behaviour of get, put, and other methods in this class is very similar to ItemEntry. Refer to its documentation for more information.

    Other considerations

    For simplicity, this class exposes values as collections. Internally, values are stored as arrays, as expected by webMethods.

    An instance manipulates a unit entry, that is, the first entry identified by the key. This is the norm in most uses cases. In rare situations where multiple entries for a key may exist and processing is required for all of those entries, use of SplitEntry would be more appropriate.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Description copied from interface: HasKey
        Returns the key associated to the entry being referenced
        Specified by:
        getKey in interface HasKey
        Returns:
        key associated to the entry
        See Also:

      • isAssigned

        boolean isAssigned()
        Description copied from interface: BaseUnitEntry
        Indicates whether there's an entry with the key.

        Note that this method doesn't take into account the type of the value in the key/value pair.

        The result is the same as invoking Document.containsKey(String) with the entry's key.

        Specified by:
        isAssigned in interface BaseUnitEntry
        Returns:
        true if an entry with the key exists; false, otherwise
        See Also:
        BaseUnitEntry.isAssigned()

      • getVal

        List<E> getVal()
        throws InexistentEntryException
        Returns the value component of an existing entry.

        Use this method when you expect an entry with the key to exist.

        If an entry with the key doesn't exist, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        entry value, possibly null
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key

      • getNonNullVal

        List<E> getNonNullVal()
               throws InexistentEntryException,
                      UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the non-null value component of an existing entry.

        Use this method when you expect an entry with the key to exist and also to have a non-null value.

        If an entry with the key doesn't exist or if it contains a null value, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        entry value, never null
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - if the entry contains a null value
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • getNonEmptyVal

        List<E> getNonEmptyVal()
                throws InexistentEntryException,
                       UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns a non-empty list value of an existing entry.

        Use this method when you expect an entry with the key to exist, and the value to be both non-null and a non-empty collection. If any of those expectations isn't met, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        entry value, never null and never an empty list
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - if the entry contains a null or empty value
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • getValOrEmpty

        List<E> getValOrEmpty()
        Returns the value component of an existing entry. It returns an empty list if the entry doesn't exist or the entry value is null.

        Use this method when you don't know whether the entry exists and you want an empty list to be returned if it doesn't.

        This method is equivalent to getValOrEmpty(NullValHandling) with NullValHandling set to NullValHandling.RETURN_DEFAULT.

        Returns:
        entry value
        See Also:
        getValOrEmpty(NullValHandling)

      • getValOrEmpty

        List<E> getValOrEmpty(NullValHandling nullValHandling)
               throws UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the value component of an existing entry or an empty list.

        Use this method when you don't know whether the entry exists and you want an empty list to be returned if it doesn't.

        Parameters:
        nullValHandling - behaviour when entry contains a null value
        Returns:
        entry value
        Throws:
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - when the entry value is null and NullValHandling.FAIL is used.
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • getValOrDefault

        List<E> getValOrDefault(List<? extends E> defaultValue)
        Returns the value component of an existing entry. The provided default value is returned if the entry doesn't exist or the entry value is null.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you want defaultValue to be returned if it doesn't.

        This method is equivalent to getValOrDefault(List, NullValHandling) with NullValHandling set to NullValHandling.RETURN_DEFAULT.

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - value to return if entry doesn't exist
        Returns:
        entry value
        See Also:
        getValOrDefault(List, NullValHandling)

      • getValOrDefault

        List<E> getValOrDefault(List<? extends E> defaultValue,
                        NullValHandling nullValHandling)
                 throws UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the value component of an existing entry or a default value.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you want defaultValue to be returned if it doesn't.

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - value to return if entry doesn't exist
        nullValHandling - behaviour when entry contains a null value
        Returns:
        entry value
        Throws:
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - when the entry value is null and NullValHandling.FAIL is used.
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • put

        void put(Iterable<? extends E> value)
        Sets the provided value as the entry's value.

        If an entry identified with the key doesn't exist, a value is created. Otherwise, the entry's value is replaced with the provided value.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value to set for the entry

      • putConverted

        void putConverted(Iterable<?> value)
        Converts the provided value and sets the converted value as the entry's value.

        Use this method in cases where the value type is different to the type you want to be stored in the entry.

        If the provided value can't be converted to the entry's type, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value to set for the entry
        See Also:
        put(Iterable)

      • remove

        void remove()
     throws InexistentEntryException
        Deletes the entry in strict mode.
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException
        See Also:
        remove(RemoveEntryOption)

      • remove

        void remove(RemoveEntryOption removeOption)
     throws InexistentEntryException
        Deletes the entry identified by the element’s key.

        Note that type used for the entry (e.g. String) is not taken into account when removing the entry. It's only done by key.

        Because this is a unit entry reference, if multiple elements exist in the document for the given key, only the first entry is deleted.

        Parameters:
        removeOption - strict or lenient removal option
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException
